reviews.text: Nice shop with helpfull service. Delicious trufles, maybe a bit too sweet, but it’s the way some sweets are :).
Enjoyed a delicious Flødeboller from here!

Really nice shop on Vesterbrogade with a large selection of different products from Jutland producers, including truffles and cream balls from Trøfleriet in Thy! I bought a coffee caramel truffle and it tasted wonderful!

Super delicious shop with lots of goodies and not least tastings. Quite a lot of bath ducks, which we hope the sweet enthusiastic and accommodating owner can dispose of in time 😉🤩👍We'll be back soon ❤️
Bought a dulche (dulche-caramel) truffle. It wasn't very big compared to the price (DKK 22), but it was really good :)

Amazing intro to pottery, was able to understand the prices and to ask all the questions.
Súper hygge experience.
I end up with 5 cups/pots.
There was some salad/lunch included and coffee.
The workshop was amazing!!!

It’s been almost two years and I feel bad I never left a review regarding this . My husband booked me a pottery course here in October 2021 for the evening course starting In November. I was still in Dubai at that time waiting for my visa to come through to come back to Denmark , on the day of my scheduled interview we got covid and hence the date was postponed , I knew this would affect my time of arrival in Denmark , so I called Yonobi the same week ( October 18/2022) and explained my situation , the girl who pick up was nice and she wished me speedy recovery , she said she will make a note of it and try to put me on a different evening batch once I’m back . But once I came back to Denmark and called yonobi , they said they can’t find anything about this call and it’s not valid . This was a different girl on the phone . And said I don’t see any email requesting for a change of date and said can’t put you in a different class or refund and hung up. Not sure if I can add a photo of the receipt here . But it was 2600 dkk and it’s a lot of money for artists like me (#12596) . I was super disappointed with the second call ,I didn’t wanna go back to this studio ever again  but now I go to many wonderful studios in Copenhagen that are filled with great art teachers and fellow artists. And I recommend you do the research and find a nicer ceramic  studio than yonobi
Nice handmade ceramic, rather high prices
lovely store with lovely people and lovely products :-)
one of the most nicest place ever! atmosphere, owner, variety of wine, quality, everything is great!
What an amazing little store! So many amazing options and the staff was super helpful they also had the cutest little shop dog! I Loved my bottle of wine I picked up
A nice store with a good selection of wine and beer. Had a nice chat with the owner and bought a few craft beers I haven't tested yet. Will definitely come back again!!

Lovely place. Went here just to look around while on a break from a work trip, and was greeted by a very passionate guy who offered me some wine to taste, even after i mentioned i wouldn't be able to buy anything - he just really liked talking about wine.

Seems like a nice, personal, passionate place, and definitely somewhere I would go if I were looking for a wine shop in Copenhagen!

awesome selection of wine and beer from all over the world. super cozy central location, part of larger concept including 8 other shops and restaurants. lady running the shop was sweet and recommended we check out one of their other shops nearby.

Part artist's studio, part flower shop, part art gallery. A breathtaking and serene break from the usual Copenhagen fare, you step into a magical, calming place where everywhere you turn your head you're going to see something beautiful.

On my walk in this street i decided to inside this incredible store.

They have really a Special style for flowers and decorations, but everything goes with the place.

You will find lot of little thing.

The tiny garden behind the house is also a think to see, it would cost 40 DKK but it’s the vault, for all this work .

A great escape in the middle of the city. Definitely one of Copenhagen's must-visit boutiques. Found it by accident while walking on the small streets by Kongens Nytorv, on a snowy afternoon. Thank God I found it! Fell in love with the place. Going in was like seeing a fairytale. Beautiful flowers everywhere, magnificent artistic ornamentations and very relaxing ambience. Went there twice to bring a friend. Coming back this summer to see the garden.

this is my accidental find ... Walking through the streets of Copenhagen.
The sculptor, designer, florist Tage Andersen.
the seller told me it was his dream to create something like this. All that is created extends far beyond simple floral arrangements. His use of old wired birdcages, mirror pieces, rusting iron and rotting fruit in sculptures.
And what a delight it is
Can't say anything about the exhibition, because we immediately turned back after entering. Keeping a lonely bird in a small cage - so appalling and unnecessary.

Looking for Danish speciality treats?
This store has gathered all the best local treats from luxury brands. Delicious! And they come in all sizes from tasty little bites to proper boxes to bring home.
Highly recommended.
You can find Wally and Whiz, Friis Holm, and many other sweets here. I asked for some taste trials, she was so kind and welcoming!Good place to buy souvenirs 🍫

Wonderful little shop with some unique flavours of chocolate and free samples. Make sure you try the Mellow tablets with olive oil. The lady at the counter was very friendly and helped me decide what to pick, offering some insights about the products and the chocolate producers.

Denmark’s best collection of unique edible, drinkable, designer and delectable treats. Only high-quality Scandinavian products. Perfect place to find that little something that shows someone you care!

Gem of a little store - a place where you can find all things delicious, tasteful and Scandinavian under one roof. At a time when we're all being urged to shop locally, by visiting Nordic Treats to buy your Christmas gifts, you support the many small local producers that they host

Bad jewelry! And bad service. I have bought earrings from them twice and both times they broke. They do not respect the right of complaint. So don't throw your hard earned money at them - if you don't care about your money, it might be a good place to send it

I bought one of their earrings a little under 1 week ago. And when I bought it, one lock was already light and almost worn out. So now here today I have lost it. The same has happened to another pr I have from there. Insanely poor quality.
Good service and nice clerks❤️
Love this beautiful shop with the finest jewellery. There is always good service and the girls really know how to guide you through the purchase.

Yesterday I bought beautiful earrings for 39€, it was packaged neatly so I didn't realize there was only ONE earring in it. Now I know that ONE pair of earrings costs €39 and not the pair! This was not pointed out, such a rip off!! :-((

Haven’t had a decent Christmas calendar in years. Here the smell was irresistible, as were the calendars, and I was even given a sample to try immediately by the handsome caramel creator who was working away on a giant piece of the heavenly stuff. Great service, wonderful caramel.
Wonderful caramels! I don’t even like licorice but you have to try the licorice caramels: amazing! Friendly staff and caramel makers. Lovely place to spot in!
Very unique and beautiful candy shop. Delicious caramels. Nice owner and great co-workers. I was allowed to take pictures. Cool place and great gift ideas ❤️👍
Handmade sweets in the shop, with authentic machinery and such a lovely addictive taste. Very friendly owner which finds time during his work to explain his philosophy. A real gem in town.
Excellent caramels made in-house. You can choose among many flavors (I enjoyed caramels with coffee) or can buy a packed mix of them. If lucky, one may watch how caramels are made in the kitchen.

Bought ten bottles of champagne from promotion  of Kjær&Sommerfeldt at the office center I work. Tasting not possible but salesman was convincing. First time in my life I taste champagne which does not taste good. Nine bottles still left, anyone  ?
Super service. God vin.
Super service.
Awesome place

For our wedding on 29/7 we had to use a lot of delicious wine, and of course it had to be from Kjær and Sommerfeldt. Over the past six months, we have visited the shop several times for knowledgeable guidance and for well-informed and pleasant wine tasting. The wines we chose are some of the best we have tasted! They were absolutely perfect for our wedding and got so many compliments from the guests!

Kjær and Sommerfeldt have been incredibly service minded throughout and we have felt very safe letting them help us. In particular, Jes has been fantastic in guiding us. We got the wines at a very good price, and they were delivered to the venue the day before the wedding free of charge. We could return the wine we didn't drink, and although there was quite a bit, we actually kept most of it because it was so delicious.

It won't be the last time we come to the store, and we will always recommend Kjær and Sommerfeldt to others who need wine for a big party!
Great service, very very professional and clean. Everyone was extraordinarily nice. 👍

Anyone who doesn't like chocolate must be deported. (except allergy sufferers)
🇩🇰
The world's best chocolate 😁👌
Excellent! Would be a reason to emigrate! Maybe a job available? 😉
Fantastic chocolate
Usually always visit Norrlyst when visiting Copenhagen.  Consistantly good food and atmosphere.  Service can sometimes be a bit much with the dish explanations but love the place.

The cherry on top of a very special day.
We got married in Copenhagen and decided to eat dinner here to celebrate. It was a very fortunate choice.

The four course menu is comprised of simple, but very well made dishes. Ingredients feel super fresh and a lot of care goes into every plate.
The wine pairing is very tasteful, and we get detailed explanations of every wine, with origins and flavor profiles.

The service is incredibly friendly, and employees and eaters alike seem happy to be there. I definitely know we were.

Set menu was delicious and the vibe in the basement area was really cool. We had the vegetarian “green” set menu. My favorite was the honey ice cream with edible flowers. It was so delicious. We also loved the chips appetizer. They were light and crispy.

I had a wonderful lunch at Norrlyst, where I tried their Smørrebrød.

The atmosphere and design of Norrlyst were truly amazing. The restaurant's interior was thoughtfully crafted, creating a cosy and inviting space that set the stage for a delightful meal. The service at Norrlyst was efficient, and the staff was attentive, making sure we had everything we needed. They added to the overall positive experience.

While there was a brief wait for the food to arrive, it was undoubtedly worth the wait. The Smørrebrød was a culinary masterpiece, showcasing the kitchen's skill and creativity, and each bite was a journey through the rich tapestry of Danish cuisine.

I had an amazing dining experience at Norrylt in Copenhagen! The staff were incredibly friendly and took the time to explain all the ingredients and concepts behind each dish, along with the appropriate utensils. We opted for one green menu and one pescatarian menu, and both were delicious. We reserved a high table next to the door, which added to the cozy ambiance. The restaurant's decor, featuring fermented weck pots, showcased true craftsmanship. Being below ground, it had a charming, intimate feel, although as a 194cm tall person, I had to navigate carefully. The wine menu perfectly complemented the dishes. Highly recommend! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Amazing place with so much interesting history. Loved every minute here. And the cakes didn't make this experience worse! Yummy! I might have a sugar rush now. Bit totally worth it!
Thanks for all the stories and good service!

This place is super popular always with a line. The cakes are decent but not like blow your mind away. Hot chocolate can be refilled once if you can get through it. Worth visiting once for the experience.

The location is absolutely stunning, and the cakes are beyond belief, incredibly delicious and crafted like pieces of art. Moreover, the hot chocolate is also exceptionally tasty.

However, the customer service didn't quite meet expectations. While not all the staff were impolite, there is definite room for improvement.

Upon our arrival, we tried to engage with the attendant (the only one wearing a hijab), but she completely disregarded us. Despite our attempts to communicate, she didn't even acknowledge our presence, which was very disrespectful.

After a brief wait, another lady stepped in and provided us with decent customer service. She was exceptionally kind and friendly. Despite the initial setback, the overall experience was positive, and I do plan to visit again.

For a 153 year old store, the place not only maintains itself well, but also keeps its high standards.   Everything still looks so beautiful.   The place brought you back in time.   Don't come here during the tourist rush hour, everyone will be overwhelmed.   The staff were polite in a Danish way.  Personal opinion, haha.

Love their old fashion pastries and also the cakes. The staff at the entrance will make sure there’s a table for you before you enter the cafe. Try the large macaroon with raspberries! Huge selection of cakes and also pastries which the staff are more than willing to help with recommendations if you need them. Not many beverage choice but what they do, they do well.

formatted_address: Torvehal 2, Linnésgade 17, B2, 1364 København K, Denmark
name: Tante T

reviews.text: Excellent costumer service! A wide variety of tea options. They provide you suggestions if you are in doubt. Highly recommended on a rainy day!
Very good selection of teas and friendly service. Comfortable seating if you can get it. A very nice place for a minute of calm in the middle of the market chaos.
Large selection of pure teas as all as blends and infusions. Very friendly staff and standard prices for loose leaf teas. Best thing is that you actually can buy hot tea drinks to go!

We were looking for place to hide from rain and stumbled upon this cozy spot. The service was absolutely amazing, lady that was working there at that time helped us choose from absolutely stunning variety of teas.

We were even provided with student discount and second infusion of our tea.

Wheter you want to stop for a while and enjoy your tea in quiet atmosphere or take it with you and explore streets of Copenhagen, this place is ideal for you.
Tried the White Tropical - absolutely gorgeous drink for summer. Highly recommend this place!

Add this place to your to-do list for Copenhagen.
It's the oldest cheese shop in Denmark, about 130 years old (and maybe a few days at the time of this review).
The place exudes creativity - lots of artsy details, which it was very hard to stop photographing;

The owner, Soren is very warm and friendly, and very knowledgeable of the cheese and stuff in the store. The cheese plate was custom made -- the choice of sides to complement the Danish cheeses was a celebration for the palate.

We loved the playful, artistic decoration -- the cute wooden mice, with watery eyes, reading from the cheese encyclopedia, opened -- you guessed right -- Danbo Danish cheese (few shelves further).

Soren and his shop are sufficient for a pretext to visit Copenhagen again.

Thank you for the wonderful experience!

The best cheese shop in Copenhagen ! Big selections. Very friendly, very knowledgeable, speak fluently English, French etc . you will spend a great time tasting and selecting some danish cheese to take home. Les fromages danois sont délicieux !!

Fantastic stop for a delicious cheese sandwich and coffee. Sit outside at the small tables and watch Copenhagen fly by. The owner, Soren, knows his cheese and he is also an artist. Perhaps he will show you some of his photographs and share a story or two about his adventures. A diamond in the city.
If you like cheese, go there! The guy that is working there (owner?) will help you with everything, tell you all that is to know about the cheese and give you recommendations.
A young vendor Who dont know anything about cheese served me in this apart from that wonderful shop, but if I come back next time it should be the owner

There is a particularly delicious smell of leather when you enter the shop at Silleknotte. A skilled craftsman with an aesthetic sense!
I have had a cover made for my laptop according to special requests, it is functional, beautifully made - and the details are taken care of 👌🏼

I bought a leather tote bag from Silleknotte. The quality and craftsmanship are top notch. Iben is very nice and helpful. The tote bag is delicious and I am very satisfied with my purchase. I will buy again from Silleknotte 😊
Incredibly beautiful leather goods and fantastic service. Was down with my now old "Petrine" bag that had come loose in the stitching, Iben repaired it quickly and with a smile.
Beautiful leather work of the highest quality - it is a pleasure to visit the shop. There is a nice atmosphere and the sweet owner is very welcoming.

Arrogant and condescending rejection when I asked for help to get a hole made in my leather belt.
Practice experience with big Ø.

My husband got me a few pieces for our wedding anniversary which were STUNNING but I had to go back and exchange one for a smaller size, shockingly found the staff to be not so friendly for no apparent reason! But other than that one staff member the store was beautiful with beautiful pieces!

[Update] In contact with Anders, very friendly shop owner who has offered advice on cleaning my piece. Will update review following the results.

This is the state of my Figaro bracelet 9k solid gold after bathing in geothermal spas in Iceland. Normally solid gold should not be oxidized by these waters. Extremely disappointed.

Anders and his team in HandcraftedCPH are truly amazing! You can come with very personal distinguished wishes for a ring and design, and they can make it happen for you and get the exact stones, colours, design that you are passionate about getting. They are there for you from beginning to end, and all communication is super fast. We've had our wedding rings as well as one very personal and particular wish ring of my own dream done. The latter required aloooot of communication back and forth as I had such specific wishes, and they are simply just there for you and: they will make sure to deliver exactly what you want and dream of. I and we will absolutely continue to use Anders and his team, as: these are really amazing artisans and jewelers. One of a kind. Thank you and bravo!!! Already have a new idea ready for spring.

Quality crafting, but tempered by miscommunication.
Our set of wedding rings has a hammered look as we wanted. When they were delivered the edges were not softened and as a result they were somewhat uncomfortable to wear, and we questioned this during the fitting but it was downplayed as insignificant. After wearing them for a month we disagreed and they agreed to soften the edges and send us the rings back, free of charge.
We were initially very happy with everything, but we later got the impression during our talks that now was the time to get the rings done.
+2 years later we still love our rings, and would use them again - but the communication would need to improve.
Fair prices, however I bought a bracelet that broke 3 times (they fixed for free all the 3 times) and the gold plated jewelry loose color pretty fast

It is challenging to make flower arrangements for your big day in online mode. But thanks to Trille, all went smoothly and I couldn’t be happier with the result and got tons of compliments for my bridal bouquet, on the day and beyond.

I would wholeheartedly recommend Trille’s Cool&Cozy to anyone looking for that one very special bouquet ❤️

The prettiest flowers! Trille made the process of getting flowers so easy and was so helpful when I was uncertain what exactly I wanted. I never got to meet her but my brother said she was so sweet! The flowers were absolutely stunning - exactly what I wanted without me even knowing!! (Photos by DreamSonder)
We absolutely loved all the flower arrangements Trille created for our wedding. It was stunning and exactly what we had in mind! Thank you so much

The whole experience with Trille was brilliant. Having sent her a photo of our outfits, she created the most beautiful, unique boutique and button hole which complimented our outfits perfectly.

I didn’t want anything too traditional or formal and she really worked her magic.

It was also brilliant meeting Trille when we went to collect the bouquet the night before, it was like chatting to and old friend and she helped us calm any night before nerves!

If you’re considering asking Trille to create a bouquet for you I couldn’t recommend her enough.

Next time we are in Copenhagen we’ll absolutely be popping in to say hello.

We got beautiful flowers for our Copenhagen elopement from Cool & Cozy!

Such a lovely and personalised service - choosing the perfect flowers to match my wife’s dress!

Tak skal du have!

Very very nice Service. Tasty food and very good Vin. Several also vegetarian dishes to choose from. You can sit inside and outside. Value for money is good. Is a shop and a restaurant. Very good Vinbar spot, recommended.

Charming spot for lunch, snacks and dinner. Not big on sweets. The staff know their stuff. Be prepared to be delighted by the stories of origin and how the owner found the wine and délicatesse du jour.
All the male staff was very friendly and kind. Seating outside on a sunny day is nice but it’s a very busy and noisy street

Nice food and food store but too expensive for what you get. We wanted to buy some foie gras and combine it with dinner . The dinner was nice but at 1700 dkk for 2 starters, 2 main courses and 2 bottles average red wine more expensive than other French restaurants in town. It was also very noisy in the shop / restaurant . The goose foie gras we bought in the shop after dinner did cost over 80 euro for 200g. We later found out that you can order the same product directly from the producer in France for a third of the price . Adding some margin surely is ok but sorry , almost tripling the price is a rip off . Expensive lessons learned .
One of my favorite places for dinner in Copenhagen! Love the authentic french atmospehere, the lovely location and great quality of service and ingredients! Definitley worth a visit !
Amazing place with great wines from small to big distributors and winemakers, great service more!
Very nice shop with a very well thought out and interesting selection of wines. Received excellent and friendly service on site and brought three bottles with me completely to my liking.
Really nice wine shop with super service. The selection is really good with good and exciting wines. Definitely worth a visit and a detour. I will definitely come back.

Dedicated shop, lots of Go wine.
They know what they are talking about. Are sweet and welcoming. Takes time to find out what you like.
Good selection
Cozy local
Service at the top
Flexible
All in all, a great recommendation from here
Great little gem of a wine shop. Vin på Nørrebro always has a good selection of very exciting wines.
Great wine selection, very friendly service.
Such a lovely place and an extensive variety of delicious wines. The people here are very down to earth and really take their time in helping you find the exact wine - whatever the food or your mood!
Best natural wine agio in Copenhagen 👌🏼 they have a huge variety of grape types  from many wineries. Highly recommended
Great, super nice Service And amazing selection of natural wines 🍷 if you are in Nørrebro don’t kids out on this shop!

Owned by young frenchies passionated & dedicated. I re-discovered amazing Gamay from domaine Saint-Cyr… but they have a lot of other beauties from all over France - even Denmark ;-) and other countries, with a great selection of natural wines.

formatted_address: Jægersborggade 4, kl. th, 2200 Copenhagen N, Denmark
name: Wilgart - Handcrafted Danish Headwear

reviews.text:
Really excellent customer service and just a lovely variety of hats in all sizes.

I bought one to take back to Australia for my dad and I know he will love it.

The man working in the store was very pleasant and helpful as well - thank you!
This is me best hat that I have ever owned! Thank you for your effort guys! Amazing experience!

The customer service is amazing, the handmade caps are of amazing quality. I discovered this shop while on a business trip in Copenhagen, and i just completed my first online order!
The service is professional, personal and friendly.

Such a refreshing shopping experience!
Amazing shop, great variety of hats and caps, and helpful staff. Thanks Thomas for helpful information.
Amazing experience with Silas at Wilgart. Superb craftsmanship with service equally as good.
Graphic ceramics in delicious colors
Great design and teacups where there is room to like tea :-)
Fantastically beautiful ceramics
Lovely place, with helpful staff and great knowledge of wines, spirits, beer and more! Great parking in the courtyard if you do not wish to park in the city where another of their shops are located
Really good service, and high level of knowledge about the wines they sell.
Good guidance and a large selection
Delicious things in many price ranges
Nice man, good service
Super store, and a lovely family run business. Top quality wines, great range of craft beers, finest of Danish chocolate, tasty herbal teas and fabulous hampers and gift ideas!! I'll be back
Nice place to get wine, sweets, licorice and other stuff like canned fish.
Very friendly, helpful and extremely knowledgeable staff. They can guide you exactly.on what you want. Superb collection of all kinds of liquor including sake ! Good collection of teas too.
A staple of Nordrefrihavnsagde. A great selection of different foreign goods. Everything from tea to cigars. Absinthe and wines.
Good selection of whiskey and chocolate
Always nice to share a good bottle of wine in the cellar 🥂

It is a wine shop that oozes environment and history: set up in the archways of perhaps the city's oldest and very large merchant's cellar.
There is a wide selection of wine in all price ranges, and on Fridays you can enjoy a glass of wine and (by prior order) tapas in furnished cozy corners or in the grocery store.
Very nice and cozy greeting
Very very enjoyable. Fine selection of wines that can be enjoyed in the Friday bar.
Beautiful wine in relaxed surroundings

The place has a cosy vibe, it’s a small bistro. The food offer is limited to 3-4 different meals, but the portions are quite generous for the price - especially moules frites.
Staff was very nice and helpful.
The food was good and the portions were quite big and the serving was amazing. Our waitress was incredibly sweet.

Awful experience! The moules are Un tasty  all
made in one sauce and the service is terribly bad.
Service was performed without any in the rest and very unprofessional/unpleasant. I didn’t feel welcomed ! I will never go back again!
Was actually very nice!!! We had mussels and fries 🍟. Loved it! 🙏🏻
Really cozy place with lots of atmosphere and good atmosphere. The food is traditional and tastes great.

Not much good to say. Had an older radio examined and got the following a price for the repair. After approx. 8 months later I am told that there are problems with the repair. It took a long time to figure it out.
I have no hope of getting the radio fixed.
VERY BAD EXPERIENCE

Professionally.
Skilled professionals.

Fantastic chocolate, you can really taste it is craftsmanship, made from scratch and with lots of love for the product!
Small shop but top service

Always the best chocolate🤤😁
And good, personal service 👍

I am a big chocolate eater, and Kardinal Chocolate is absolutely
the best I have ever received TOP CLASS :-)
It's hard to choose, but I want to highlight the small cream buns and the Asestängerne, these are my two absolute favorites - yum 👍👍👍

Fantastic chocolate of high quality, you can also make special orders such as Easter eggs. It is top class chocolate for relatively cheap money. The employees are also very friendly, they trust their customers. Eg. I once had to buy chocolates for my grandmother, but I had forgotten the money, they were so kind because they knew me that I could bring the money the next day.
Helped me pick a good wine as a thank you gift for my friends. Very helpful and wrapped the wine in gift wrap
Not friendly. I asked for a wooden box thinking I would also get some wine but he was so unfriendly that I just left and will not come back.
Super god service!
Henrik has a really good selection of especially Rum and Whiskey and it is always a pleasure to have a chat with Henrik and above all it is also about supporting the locals.
I have bought wine from Henrik at Butler Vin several times, and every time I have been impressed by his knowledge and ability to choose exactly the right wine for me and my guests.
Surprisingly decent selection of bourbon, knowledgeable and friendly staff
Probably the best wine & spirituous beverages shop (+ beers). Extremely good customer service.

Cozy boutique vibe with incredible expertise. Usually I budget at least 30-40 minutes in here because the amount of sheer knowledge and help you can get in selecting a wine, rum, or whiskey is beyond call of duty. These guys live and breathe their products. You can find plenty of rarities that you won't find in other stores. The charming and personal service is among best in Copenhagen.
Great customer service and nice selection of local and other craft beer. Prices were cheper than in the other bottle shops we visited.

I've known Fleming Toft for over 20 years now. He is very interested in what he does and if you are interested in something special he hasn't tried before he will probably order it. Always excellent service with a little bit of old school shop keeping by Toft senior. Excellent selection of beers from Europe and America.
Awesome shop with great products and friendly service.
Nice store with things that you usually do not find it elsewhere!

Cosy speciality boutique;
Warm your chilled cheeks during the cold winter months with rum-ganache, a mug of coffee or a glass of red wine  - or chill your warm cheeks with a glass of rosé during the hot summer months.

Enjoy the diverse people of Amager all year round and leave with a little something for yourself or someone you care for.

They have a nice selection of specialty food wares sourced from around the world and local.
What a super little shop! Full of amazing products from around the world! A great coffee and view to the beach! 😁
The service (the girl) was simply fantastic and we l Iove the products they have.

Ordered beers for a birthday gift and when I was paying I realized that the prices did not match, the seller told me about the packaging $. I accepted it since it was already ready, even though I was not informed before that this was going to be charged.
After I paid I asked if I could have a small bag cause I was on the bike, I was asked 4 kr. for it. Really? Felt like shopping at  Netto.

Absolute fantastic place for any true beer lovers. They have a huge selection of anything from IPA’s to Stout, Barley Wine and more. The couple that owns the place are super nice, very friend, service minded and have a huge beer knowledge. So they are great for finding something you would like:)

A selection of 400+ craft beer. Buy and bring home, or enjoy them at the premises. Excellent service. If you are looking to buy a gift, they do the most amazing gift basket wrapping with the beers of your choice.

Small and well kept beer and alcohol shop in Amager. The owner is extremely nice and can help you with suggestions and advice. The beer selection especially is great!! A bit expensive but you pay for quality

Although I can call myself a real Amagerkaner, I have always doubts about the quality of shops and restaurants here compared to those in the "cooler" neighbourhood.

I have seen this bottle shop so many times on my way home with 350s back when I was still living in Tårnby *shudders* but I never really thought that it would be interesting, but since I had the quest to find Smith's Organic Chocolate Stout that I first discovered at Amager Ølhus, I had to brace myself and entered this place.

...if I were a doubter before, now I'm converted.

This place has great selection of beer but I can see they specialise more from Amager Bryghus - after all they are in Amager, right? You could mostly find Amager Bryghus stuff here, as well as other big names Mikkeller, BrewDog, Evil Twin, local and international. They also have one side reserved for Belgian beers so if you're a fan, you won't be disappointed.

Most important for me is that they have plenty of Smith's Organic Chocolate Stout, so I can always come here when I have no more in my fridge and this place being in my hood, I could see some "dangers" attached to it :)
Nice shop with great selection, knowledgeable and friendly staff.
New and bigger store located near Kløvermarken. Hard to find at first - great selection 🙌🏻
René and Peter are the A-Team. They know their wines, whiskies, and all others. Superb place and selection.
Pretty good selection of wine and booze. Helpful staff. Opening hours could be longer.
Excellent wine shop. Great service. Good selection of Rum and other spirits.

Choose quality if you buy meat. If you choose Slagter Lund, you choose tradition and quality. I like this butchery. I also really like the products they offer as street food (e.g. Jazz Festival). Nice staff.
Nice butcher with good cold cuts and good meat and good service.
Very good quality! Never tasted such good lamb. Everything else is just the finest. Great selection, great service and highly recommended.
Absolutely fantastically delicious tapas

Hi Peter.
Was with you on Saturday and bought e.g. 2 lamb chops. You just have to know that they were amazing, juicy and delicious.
Kind regards, Erik Brøndum-Eriksen from Svendborg

Dad's really sick w cancer & I asked him-"What do you want?" He said:" Tatar from Friis".. He's got no appetite but this meat we both enjoyed & his eyes was beaming with love for me. Great butcher. Thanks Friis. You made our day.

We purchased a leg of lamb for an Easter roast here and it was fantastic! They were super friendly and welcoming (even though we got there RIGHT on closing time), and gave me some great advice. We rarely eat meat, but when we do, we want to make sure it's really high quality and organic to minimize the impact on the environment, so we will definitely be coming back here again.
Great service, selection and quality. Always willing and able to get me what I want. A little dear but you get what you pays for - quality !
The most amazing butcher in Copenhagen!
Very very high quality, maybe the best in the CPH Area

formatted_address: H. C. Ørsteds Vej 50, 1879 Frederiksberg, Denmark
name: Slagter Lars

reviews.text:
Award winning butcher.
Especially the "frikadelle" which comes in three different flavours are really tasty and delicious.
Bought beef tail here today. Opened it when I got home to find it was actually rotten and smelling like sulfur. Left it on the counter to see if it would mellow, but it got worse so I threw it out.

Mixed experiences from this butcher. Sadly it is always expensive, after 3-4 visits i'm not convinced that the price is worthwhile for the quality. Have had chicken that smelt like rotten eggs and some excellent sausages which muddies my review even further. Have yet to look elsewhere so it is hard to judge whether this is typical or not.
Good price-quality relationship and a great service
Fridadelle with mold on it. First and last time - disgusting.
Very cheap market , in comparison with Danish prices market  Very crazy...
Good quality, fresh and perfect price
More on that later

Super butcher! There are not many left, so we must take good care of those who are left. This Christmas season, their jam must be highlighted as one of the best, among many other delicious butcher's products. Support the little good butcher, they deserve it!

A gem!!!
There is really a long way between the good Danish butchers today. Either they must be too fine or bad.

This butcher is probably the best I have tried to date. They have a delicious selection and the prices are reasonable.
Just love this butcher. Overshopping too wildly!
Absolutely fantastic butcher. We've got the tastiest roast pork ever. Highly recommend ♥️
Friendly, helpful and decent price! Thanks :)
Worst service I have experienced at any store. And I say that without hesitation. As a rule, quality and good service go hand in hand. This is not the case with butcher Steen and Ko

I am currently reviewing skin cancer, and thus receive treatment in certain areas with radiation. Therefore, I must not get sun in these specific places, on which I cover this with a scarf. The butcher immediately comments on this: Are you freezing? - I have to explain the situation here, which I find extremely unnecessary, just because I have to deal with an ignoramus. In addition, the selection is non-existent and the quality mediocre; as best. The man never bothers, after insulting me to the extreme, to set the machine to finely chop my tartar, but on the other hand is coarse and not pleasant to eat at all.
A really good butcher shop. Super good ingredients and service that is good for ideas and advice for dinner

A particularly good butcher with the best master butcher. Really good and personal service and always a robbery story up your sleeve if you're up for it. Super good meat and there is no doubt that it is a real craftsman.

A small butcher's shop with a large selection and really high-quality smørrebrød.
The service is friendly, welcoming, smiling and helpful.
The sandwich is nicely presented, well laid out, well prepared and really tasty.
These are large pieces at a reasonable price.
Thank you for a good experience. 😊
Bought a kilo of minced beef for DKK 160. Already thought it looked used when he chopped it. It was completely brown when I had to use it in the evening and smelled and tasted of yeast
Good little butcher with delicious salads, cold meats, etc.

Until two years ago, I lived close to Butcher Jens and quickly became very fond of Jens' delicious lamb and pork.
Now I like to drive from Christianshavn to Jens to buy the same goods. Beautiful Danish lamb!
It is expensive to go to a real butcher, but the quality is top notch. The service is good, they have time to explain if you have any doubts, and you always feel welcome.
Good service. Fresh seafood.
Always nice and pleasant service. And the fish is top quality, have been there almost once a week during the last year - never a bad fish!
Highest quality for reasonable prices and the nicest guy at the counter.
Top quality, awesome and friendly service
Super service

My favourite fish market! The fish is always fresh, the shop is extremely clean and the staff is friendly!!
Their spreads are delicious and their shrimp tempura is to die-for!
Are you searching for a high quality fishmonger with totally fresh fish? This is the perfect place!
Fresh seafood and friendly staff
Pick up New Year's Eve dinner - at the city's best fishing shop - Kodan on Frederiksberg
Good selection of Seafood. Knowledgeable and nice staff. Fresh and good tasting. I will come again :)
Claus Oxholm is super friendly and he knows his stuff. Countless excellent wines and at a good price. I love visiting his shop and the wine never disappoints. Highly recommended.
Great selection of small wineries many of which are rising stars with exceptional value for money
Knowledgeable staff that are eager to help find the best suitable wine and spirits for your needs

Probably Copenhagen's best wine shop! Claus and co. manages to provide an enormously high level of service and competence. You are always greeted with a smile, and get unsnobbish advice about wines at all levels, depending on your needs. Claus is also eminent for pairing wine with food, and vice versa. Stop by if you're nearby, or go there anyway. It's worth a detour!

Absolutely fantastic wine shop.
Claus is incredibly welcoming and has an incredibly broad knowledge which he conveys to perfection. Regardless of whether you are a new wine enthusiast, a serious collector or you just want good advice for a good bottle, you will get unrivaled guidance.
It also doesn't hurt that there is often a small anecdote or a comparison with various music genres and artists along the way.
All in all, great service, reasonable prices, a good and wide selection (most of which are our own imports) and last but not least, a desire to please just your taste.
🍾🍷🥂

Very rude. Called to ask if a common fish was in stock, was told that they would be right back, but was instead left hanging on the line for 10 minutes before my patience was spent. I honestly think they forgot about the call. Will be buying fish elsewhere.
One high quality fishmonger I found in Copenhagen. I appreciated kindness and skill.
Sustainable caught fish, nice in house products and friendly service. As a local, this is my go to for fish.
Great people selling great fish
Love this shop ! Great service !
I loved how relaxed and nice this was quality wise.
Excellent place, very professional, very friendly
Fair price, fresh fish and good quality. Fantastic service.
Lots of selection for fresh seafood. Highly recommended!
Great selection and good service!

Excellent fish shop! Fresh and qualitative see food, very nice service and the best fish frikadelles, which one can buy by a „regular fisherman“. Last time as foreigners and new to a danish cuisine got a good advice for cooking a cod roe, thank you, we’ve managed it and it was delicious
The best fish shop in Copenhagen! Good quality and always fresh fish and salads on good prices.
THe best option if you live in Copenhagen for both quality and attention to the customers. Strongly recommended. They know their job so ask for suggestions, tips and anything you may look for.
Always best selection of fresh fish and seafood. Friendly service by the owners or Kim. Fair prices, lower than other shops in center of town especially at the market "torvehellerne "!
Great fish monger. They are very welcoming and are happy to explain what they have and how to cook it
When I need fish or seafood I come here, they have great product and knowledge and always with a smile!
Good and fresh fish.
Ok
Super service
Super
Falsely advertising the origin of their fish and products, which is illegal.
Simply the best place for fresh fish and freshly prepared marinated herring, etc.
There are lots of seafoods and they are fresh! The owner is also so kind.
Best fresh fish market in Østerbro
Great choice of fresh fish.
Good selection, fresh, expensive.

Perhaps Denmark's best! Also try their many ready meals such as salmon tapas or crayfish tail salad! Not expensive considering the quality! Can be reached in walking distance from Hellerup station and beach!

Perhaps Denmark's best fishmonger! Also try their many ready-made dishes such as salmon tapas or crayfish tail salad! Not expensive considering the quality!
Beautifully presented and really nice items incl. various dishes, salads including seaweed, and four kinds of fish patties. Who can resist the flash-fried tuna?

A mecca of a fish business. We were supposed to have lunch with the family and I had been sent to town to buy eels.
I got my eel, but I also got a number of their delicious salads and everything I brought home made me very happy.
It is a shame that there are now so few of these lovely specialist shops. It is a pleasure that the quality in those that remain is of this caliber.
This business can be highly recommended.
Outright recommends inflicting suffering on animals before death. Ouch, that's so unnecessary. Lobsters taste great, but kill them properly before cooking the animal.
They have a wide range of sea-food collection. They also sell ready-to-eat fishes.

Very reasonable prices compared to other vendors, also Kind and knowledgable Folks Here.

Going there since 7years.

Absolute theft!
We ordered “Torsk Fisk” , 3-4kgs which has a market price between 100kr-195kr. Upon arrival of a preorder, we were asked to pay 300dkk per 1kg!
When we requested 1kg instead, the lady increased the price tight thereto 400dkk.

Here are the prices from online order, delivered right to your door: Kystfisken, Nordfra etc.

Don't get me wrong, they do have FRESH fish & seafood and a great selection too. However the only thing I keep coming back for is their 'ready to fry fish cakes' which costs 130,-/kg which is tasteful and at a decent price to pay for.
All the other things cost double or triple the price of what you can get from online fish stores. The thing is they're the only physical shop around Amager so I think they pretty much can take whatever price they want to which is a bit sad. Because I believe more people will eat fish if they can get it fresh and at affordable price.
Very well organized fish market. Good service, standard quality and easy to shop place

The bedt Italian supermarket in Copenhagen and the choices are great.
Plus, there is a cafe that sells some nice croissants

Ok so good things first: lots of amazing Italian produce, interesting layout, and it happens to be near where I'm staying here in Copenhagen for a month.

Negatives: Copenhagen prices and then some

What I tried: pistachio tiramisu and classic tiramisu

The verdict: I'm not being harsh for the sake of being harsh, but these were among the worst tiramisu I have ever tried. And before anyone says that I'm not Italian and therefore not an expert, tiramisu is my favourite dessert and I have eaten a LOT and made it many times myself, trying various recipes (I'm a glutton and a food geek / enthusiast). This may be what some people want in a tiramisu, but it's almost not tiramisu to me.

I started with the pistachio one and the mascarpone layers were *sour* and tasted like pure cream cheese (almost not mascarpone - it had the texture but not the taste, which was very weird), with hardly any pistachio flavour and little sweetness. The texture was lazy and a chore to eat - like they just mixed cream cheese and not even the best pistachio cream together and left it at that. I'm not sure what the ladyfingers were soaked in and miraculously they did add some complexity to the whole thing, but overall it could not be saved.

The classic version was alcohol free, which I can understand but it's not my preference and I think it's also a cost cutting and profit maximising trick. Again there was a thick, one-dimensional mascarpone layer, the ladyfingers soaked in the coffee mixture were also fine and made it partially edible, but overall, this was a huge waste of money and I think anyone making tiramisu like this should take a good, hard look at themself because this is embarrassing. I threw them away less than half finished.

Hopefully rather than being offended and defensive, they will take this on board and improve the recipes...

Unfortunately a bit overrated.
Their prices are very high which is understandable considering it’s Copenhagen but too much. The prices for their fresh food/panini in their cafe is not worth it. Their paninis are decent but not worth 65kr at all. It is mostly bread and I got two ‘barely there’ pieces of mozzarella while the one displayed in the front had a whole ball of mozzarella.(check photo) falsely advertised. I will not be buying their fresh pre made food again.
Their grocery store however offers a lot of different Italian ingredients which are great.
Too bad their food in the cafe is incredibly overpriced for what you actually receive.
They also had some cake lying out on display and the cheesecake had completely fallen apart yet still selling it. I went to Supermarco for the first time almost a year ago but unfortunately has only gotten worse.

Supermarco is a diamond in the city of Copenhagen. It bring us some of Italy's best products in a fantastic shop. I love the fact that we can taste the wine and enjoy some nice food on the premises. The service is always great and the selection huge. A must place to visit at least once a month.

Exciting Italian equipped supermarket with all the good stuff, like fresh pasta, Parma, cheese, pecorino, fresh cut.
Also have a small cafeteria with great food or the hungry stomach asking for Italian food.
Best food market in all Copenhagen
The best quattro formaggi pizza I've ever tried. Also their dough is really tasty. This place is now my favourite pizza place in Copenhagen :)

We tried the pizza first time and it was really good. But the second time the pizza was utterly disappointing and they forgot to add the extra cheese I ordered and paid for.
We tried again a few times, where the pizza quality shifted and changed very remarkably from time to another. On top of everything, we had to experience his extremely rude and aggressive attitude and again the pizza was not as expected. Buying a pizza there is very similar to lottery, you never know if it’s good or disappointing, and this also applied to his attitude.
Got into a bad mood after his unexplained attitude, just out of the blue. Sometimes he is nice but most of the times he can be really unfriendly. I don’t need that when buying a pizza. The pizza was not charity. Never there again
No nonsense pizza place with very fair prices. Really good doe, not drenched in oil like other places. The Mascarpone pizza is crazy good.
Good pizza place..Always great experience to be here. Pizza's taste amazingly good. 🤘👍
Cozy place, great pizza, kind owner.

Great variety of sandwiches, bread, pastries and some cakes. San pellegrino is also sold. Very good coffee. Sandwiches are toasted. I had the ham and cheese, excellent elastic and crispy bread, HOWEVER, they are missing a sandwich with mozzarella, being an Italian place (and hence 4 stars). They have some small shelves selling Italian produce, see pictures. Worth checking out!

Best focaccia in town! 🥪🇮🇹  It is located inside the fresh mercato. You could buy to take away or eat outside. There are tables around the area where you could sit down. A part from sanwiches, the place offers pastries or cakes so it is suitable for breakfast or brunch. I recommend the mortadella focaccia. Order it and ask for have it grilled. It was delicious!😋
Great carrot cake! Kind staff and well located.

Very good service but WORST pistachio cake I’ve had in my life.
No taste. Full of colouring, artificial flavours absolutely NOT worth the price, not worth the sugar calories either

It is a great spot for some danish food with a little Italian twist.
Fabulous buzz around the market.

formatted_address: Gasværksvej 4A, St th, 1650 Copenhague V, Denmark
name: Gastronomer

reviews.text:
A little Slice of Italy and France here in Copenhagen !
Discovered this little gem by chance, picked up a still hot baguette made onsite throughout the day !! Just like in Paris !! How cool is that !
Will definitely be coming back and wholeheartedly expect to become a regular customer !

We used Gastronomer to create a wedding cheese “cake” and we were blown away by their service. Stephane was incredibly attentive, the cheeses were delicious, and the delivery and logistics were super smooth. We spoke to a couple of cheese shops and as soon as we went into Gastronomer and spoke to Stephane we knew he would give us the best experience. Highly recommend for any catering events.

Wow this place is outstanding!!!!! Forget super Marco , here you can find local true French Italian food , gourmet.
Stephan the  owner will take you through his shop with lots of care , he is super experienced in the food sector - true professional.
I highly recommend the fresh pasta and the French cheeses from goat - this will be my second home.

Where to start ?
Amazing place in Copenhagen to find French cheeses, charcuterie (and much more). Prices are normal, nothing overpriced. Always a pleasure to visit this cute small store, where you will be served like a king/queen.
I can only recommend !

Amazing store to find the tastiest french cheeses in Copenhagen. Forget about overpriced Toverhallerne market and add this adress to your list! The owner is super passionate and can make Tapas for your events.

Le Saint Felicien de Christian Janier est incroybale, je recommande !

formatted_address: H. C. Ørsteds Vej 48, 1879 Frederiksberg, Denmark
name: Gastronomia Italiana 1 (H.C. Ørsteds Vej)

reviews.text:
As a regular visitor I can say that this is a great place to get pizza. Large menu of flavours, lunchtime deals, and friendly service.

On a 2-3 occasions there has been a slightly burnt crust and they will often give a discount or free pizza!
best pizzieria in copenhagen with great service.... the workers are well mannered and friendly...love to eat pizza form there..
Really sad stuff... pizza is doughy, tasteless and expensive. There are other places with good pizza in the area. Not even worth a try here....
Amazingly good pizza! Closest thing I got to real Italian/Naples pizza
Absolutely fantastic pizza, with a very cheap price!

Generally a great selection of meats, of course some won’t be available BUT he has what we need and always has the biggest smile and helpful attitude!! love love love gils deli (bought around 10 times now)

A small but efficient store, selling deli products that make locally and a variety of frozen meat and vegetarian products.
Very kind service and reasonable prices
Please note the signage regarding parking - this is Copenhagen ...

A stalwart of the Jewish community in Copenhagen, providing excellent fresh beef cuts, some of the best deli and sausages I’ve ever had (the chili ones are a must-buy) and a slightly limited selection of frozen meat (chicken, lamb, etc.)
Fantastic! Only shop in Denmark that sells kosher.
Small, local, kosher, friendly!
Nothing special. Opening hours subject to change randomly

Cozy shop with exciting, foreign specialties and, not least, very fresh flowers that last a long time in the vase. The selection of fruit is also good, and often there is more to choose from than many other places.
The shop is the local Bring "post office", where the long opening hours (also at weekends) are an advantage.

Nice little local greengrocer/florist/Asian market.

Big fan of being able to buy your vegetables individually, so you get rid of nets of 10 pieces of which 3 have gone bad.

the flowers are at a fair price.

If you like Asian food, there is a lack of fun and delicious ingredients that you cannot get in the usual supermarkets.
Good products good service but forget to buy what you ask for
Sweet and very welcoming owners. They have what you need in the Asian kitchen and in addition beautiful flowers.

They have allot of foods from, india, Pakistan, turkiya and African countries...just love the frech breads they are making from the Owen...they have also fresh meat department...eveything is clean and nice and also very cheap.....other shops from nørrebro could learn from them when it comes to service, cleaning and language....love you all and keep up the good work..

First of all we waited alot for the butcher and when he arrived, he was very rude and impolite. When we asked if he could cut the meat into smaller pieces, he rudely said no and told that he was “busy”
Avoid the butcher. Bad quality and hygiene. The butcher is rude and always does a bad job.
We can get fresh vegetables and fruits.

Great Super Market,
All Pakistani, Indian food and groceries available
